flawed_nl_solution:
On the night of the dance 70/100*400 = <<70/100*400=4000/7>>4000/7 students who showed up to the party were invited.
If 40/100 of those invited to the party had their invitation revoked, there were 40/100*4000/7 = <<40/100*4000/7=1600/7>>1600/7 students who showed up and had their invitation revoked.
The number of invited students who attended the party is 4000/7-1600/7 = <<4000/7-1600/7=2400/7>>2400/7
#### 2400/7

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 280, not 4000/7. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
